DataElement.preferredName: Change ALK Tyrosine Kinase Receptor Nucleotide Sequence And/Or Amino Acid Sequence Detection Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of nucleotide and/or amino acid sequencing change(s) detected in the ALK tyrosine kinase receptor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Change ALK Tyrosine Kinase Receptor Nucleotide Sequence And/Or Amino Acid Sequence Detection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:ALK tyrosine kinase receptor (1620 aa, ~176 kDa) is encoded by the human ALK gene. This protein is involved in ligand binding, tyrosine phosphorylation and signal transduction._The sequence of nucleotide residues along an RNA or DNA chain._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._The sequence of amino acids along a polypeptide chain._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Concepts.definition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Property.preferredName: ALK Tyrosine Kinase Receptor Nucleotide Sequence And/Or Amino Acid Sequence Detection
Property.preferredDefinition: ALK tyrosine kinase receptor (1620 aa, ~176 kDa) is encoded by the human ALK gene. This protein is involved in ligand binding, tyrosine phosphorylation and signal transduction._The sequence of nucleotide residues along an RNA or DNA chain._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._The sequence of amino acids along a polypeptide chain._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

Concepts.definition: ALK tyrosine kinase receptor (1620 aa, ~176 kDa) is encoded by the human ALK gene. This protein is involved in ligand binding, tyrosine phosphorylation and signal transduction.
The sequence of nucleotide residues along an RNA or DNA chain.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The sequence of amino acids along a polypeptide chain.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.
